{"step_by_step_thinking": "The submandibular duct, also known as Wharton's duct, is a salivary duct in the mouth. To expose it via an intraoral approach, an incision would need to be made in the mucous membrane, which lines the inside of the mouth. The buccinator is a muscle of the cheek, and the masseter is a muscle of the jaw, neither of which would need to be incised to expose the submandibular duct.", "answer_choice": "B. Mucous membrane"}
